title: Tyson Andrews
text:
Tyson Andrews (born 6 February 1990) is an Australian professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer. He plays at and previously played for the <a href="Manly%20Warringah%20Sea%20Eagles">Manly Warringah Sea Eagles</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a>.
Background.
Born in <a href="Maitland%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Maitland, New South Wales</a>, Andrews is of <a href="Indigenous%20Australians">Indigenous Australian</a> descent and moved to <a href="Queensland">Queensland</a> at a young age. He played his junior rugby league for the <a href="Queensland%20Rugby%20League%20Wide%20Bay%20Division%23Sunshine%20Coast%20Junior%20Rugby%20League">Maroochydore Swans</a>, before being signed by the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a>.
Playing career.
In 2008 and 2009, Andrews played for the Brisbane Broncos' <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">NYC</a> team.
In 2010, Andrews quit <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> and pursued <a href="boxing">boxing</a>. He won the Australian heavyweight amateur title.
In 2011, Andrews moved to <a href="Mackay%2C%20Queensland">Mackay, Queensland</a> to play for Wests, a local team. He was then brought into the squad of <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a> team <a href="Mackay%20Cutters">Mackay Cutters</a> after impressing their coaching staff.
In June 2013, Andrews signed a 2-year contract with the <a href="Manly%20Warringah%20Sea%20Eagles">Manly Warringah Sea Eagles</a> starting in 2014.
In Round 18 of the <a href="2014%20NRL%20season">2014 NRL season</a>, Andrews made his <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> debut for the Sea Eagles against the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a>.
On 13 February 2015, Andrews played for the <a href="Indigenous%20All%20Stars%20%28rugby%20league%29">Indigenous All Stars</a> against the <a href="NRL%20All%20Stars%20team">NRL All Stars</a> in the annual <a href="2015%20All%20Stars%20match">All Stars match</a>.
